Description: Body sherd of Chian, possibly Simple Animal Style, pottery chalice or Type B kantharos; white slip; interior streakily glazed (fired reddish); bottom of lotus bud in added white outline with added red centre above two white bands; exterior reserved; inscription on exterior.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Naukratis, Possibly Site 28 (Petrie) [based on pencil mark and label]
Curator's comments: There is a paper label with the number '28' glued to the interior surface and the same number is written in pencil on the exterior surface. The size of the sherd, the lack of diagnostic details and the absence of decoration on the exterior surface make it impossible to determine whether it comes from a kantharos or a chalice. Chalice Style chalices (including patterned chalices) have little decoration on their interior and exterior; given the size of the sherd, it may come from an undecorated part of the chalice. Kantharoi Type B (See Williams, D. ‘Aigina, Aphaia-Tempel 5. The pottery from Chios’, Archäologischer Anzeiger 1983, 169) also have very little decoration.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.1468) (phase 2)
